Issues.Title: Syntax error in Tour of Heroes example
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description I'm following along the Tour of Heroes tutorial and ran into an issue in Section 2: Displaying a List. It is in the part where the mock-heroes array constant is imported and used. The documentation says to update the HeroesComponent class like: ``` javascript export class HeroesComponent implements OnInit { heroes = HEROES; ``` but this throws the following error: > ERROR in src/app/heroes/heroes.component.ts(11,11): error TS2304: Cannot find name 'HEROES'. I think it should be changed to: ``` javascript export class HeroesComponent implements OnInit { heroes: Hero[] = HEROES; ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt2#displaying-heroes ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: docs: update Google entity in all license headers
Issues.Body:
In #27880, we bumped the year and some entity labels from `Google Inc.` to `Google LLC`. But there are a _few_ more files that we need to update as well.

I've compiled that into a remote branch here: https://github.com/CaerusKaru/angular/tree/adam/entity. A simple diff shows that this amounts to **_3025_** files that need to be updated in angular/angular.

Although it might cause minimal disruption due to the nature of the diff, it's highly unlikely we want to do this all in one PR. So I'm opening this issue to track how we want to pull this off.

Some possibilities:
1. We do it on a file-by-file basis, like with `clang-format` fixes
2. We do it one package at a time, starting with the least-used/updated packages and working our way up
3. We do it all at once (not recommended)
4. We get Google to switch back to an `Inc.` just to save us the trouble üòÑ
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs: update Google entity in all license headers" (#28095)

Issues.Title: Union types cause error even though conditionally segregated with instanceof
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/forms I specifically can produce the issue in @angular/forms, but I believe the issue is more generally with the Typescript compiler ### Is this a regression? I do not believe so, or I do not know ### Description I have a variable defined by a union of multiple types. If I conditionally narrow down to one type in the code below, using instanceof, I see an error due to a type that I am not referencing in the if block. If I try to build using ng serve, the CLI compiler fails with the error below, although active editing only causes the error to show in the console while it states that it compiled successfully, as well as showing the error in my IDE. Here is the minimal code where the problem occurs: 

  @Input() parentForm: FormGroup | NgModelGroup | NgForm;
  @Input() options: {values: any};

  constructor(private fb: FormBuilder) {};

  ngOnInit() {
    if (this.parentForm instanceof NgModelGroup || this.parentForm instanceof NgForm) {

    } else if (this.parentForm instanceof FormGroup) {
      this.options.values.forEach(value => {
        this.parentForm.addControl(value.value, this.fb.control(""));
      });
    }
  }
I receive the error: 
Property 'addControl' does not exist on type 'FormGroup | NgModelGroup | NgForm'.
  Property 'addControl' does not exist on type 'NgModelGroup'.
According to the Typescript spec, I shouldn't even need an "else if". Just an "else" should work. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-f5s4m5?file=src%2Fapp%2Fhello.component.ts ## üî• Exception or Error 


error TS2339: Property 'addControl' does not exist on type 'FormGroup | NgModelGroup | NgForm'.
  Property 'addControl' does not exist on type 'NgModelGroup'.
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: test(ivy): mark tests where checkNoChanges results are different in the view engine and ivy
Issues.Body:
Looked some more into the 2 failing tests marked with FW‚Äå-823 and the test failures can be linked to 2 separate issues:

* view engine throws  ‚ÄúExpression has changed after it was checked‚Äú even on the first template pass. This conceptually doesn‚Äôt makes sense as we know that we _will_ have a different value (as compared to the stored value) on the first template pass. At the same time view engine can‚Äôt detect the situation where the value flips to `undefined` on the first template pass as initially the stored value is equal to `undefined`. I believe that ngIvy behaviour makes more sense and we should stick with it.
* the error message produced by the view engine contains a property name for which a binding fails and it would be rather cumbersome to have the same error message in ngIvy. At the same time an error thrown in ngIvy will have a stack trace pointing to the _exact_ place of binding and with proper source maps support it should be obvious which binding fails. I would argue that this is more valuable information as with the view engine it is hard to identify which binding fails, exactly (for cases where there are multiple bindings with the same name).

All in all I believe that the existing ngIvy behaviour makes more sense and we should document differences as a deliberate breaking change. This PR marks existing view engine tests as `modifiedInIvy` and adds new tests to illustrate ngIvy behaviour.

If reviewers are fine with this approach I will document things in the breaking changes doc.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test(ivy): mark tests where checkNoChanges results are different in the view engine and ivy" (#28073)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): support for multiple ICU expressions in the same i18n block
Issues.Body:
There were two issues with multiple ICU expressions in the same i18n block:
- the regexp that was used to parse the text wasn't able to handle multiple ICU expressions, I've replaced it with parsing the text and searching for brackets (which is what we ended up doing in the end anyway)
- we allocate node indexes for nodes generated by the ICU expressions which increases the expando value, but we would create the nodes for those cases during the update phase. In the mean time we would create some nodes during the creation phase (comment nodes for ICU expressions, text nodes, ...) with an auto increment index. This means that any node created after an ICU expression would get the following index value, but the ICU case nodes expected to use the same index as well... There was a mismatch between the auto generated index, and the expected index which was causing problems when we needed to select those nodes for updates later on. To fix it, I've added the expected node index to the list of mutate codes that we generate, and we do not use an auto increment value anymore.


FW-905 #resolve
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): support for multiple ICU expressions in the same i18n block" (#28083)

Issues.Title: Object spread in environment files fails for production configuration when used in modules
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core and maybe @angular/cli ### Is this a regression? No, however this issue was also present in angular 7.1.x ### Description Environment files that are composed using the spread operator do not work when used in a production configuration (`ng serve|build -c production`). When attempting to pass environment to a module via forRoot (see example below), the environment being passed to the module is missing the environment properties that should have been copied via the object spread operator. Note that Object.assign does not work as well. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Step 1: Clone https://github.com/dougpool/aot-prod-env Step 2: `ng serve -c dev` and check screen/console (works as desired) Step 3: `ng serve -c production` and check screen/check console (missing common env message is the bug) ## üî• Exception or Error See project README.md for detailed expected output and examples Environment files composed from other files should work in production mode and have properties copied into environment via the object spread operator and the environment is passed to another module common-env.ts ``` export const commonEnv = { // Are we running in production mode production: false, // common mesg commonMessage: 'Seen by all envs', }; ``` environment.prod.ts ``` import * as common from './common-env'; export const environment = { ...common.commonEnv, production: true, envMessage: 'Prod message', }; ``` Code where correct environment fails to get created app.module.ts snippet ``` @NgModule({ declarations: [AppComponent], // env here is not correct imports: [BrowserModule, FeatureModuleModule.forRoot(env)], providers: [], bootstrap: [AppComponent], }) ``` Instead, the properties are not copied when the the application is served or built with the `ng` command. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 




```
Angular CLI: 7.2.1
Node: 10.15.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.2.0
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Issues.Title: Ivy compiler output of CommonModule is not optimal for tree-shaking
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üêû bug report



### Description

When using ivy in compatibility mode, with `platformBrowser`, the final bundle is not optimal for tree-shaking. As in the final bundle the `CommonModule` references all module definitions and thus they are marked as used and cannot be dropped by webpack.

```js
var CommonModule = /** @class */ /*@__PURE__*/ (function () {
    function CommonModule() {
    }
    /*@__PURE__*/ _angular_core__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__["…µsetClassMetadata"](CommonModule, [{
            type: _angular_core__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__["NgModule"],
            args: [{
                    declarations: [COMMON_DIRECTIVES, COMMON_PIPES],
                    exports: [COMMON_DIRECTIVES, COMMON_PIPES],
                    providers: [
                        { provide: NgLocalization, useClass: NgLocaleLocalization },
                    ]
                }]
        }], function () { return []; }, null);
    CommonModule.ngModuleDef = _angular_core__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__["…µdefineNgModule"]({ type: CommonModule, bootstrap: [], declarations: [NgClass,
            NgComponentOutlet,
            NgForOf,
            NgIf,
            NgTemplateOutlet,
            NgStyle,
            NgSwitch,
            NgSwitchCase,
            NgSwitchDefault,
            NgPlural,
            NgPluralCase,
            AsyncPipe,
            UpperCasePipe,
            LowerCasePipe,
            JsonPipe,
            SlicePipe,
            DecimalPipe,
            PercentPipe,
            TitleCasePipe,
            CurrencyPipe,
            DatePipe,
            I18nPluralPipe,
            I18nSelectPipe,
            KeyValuePipe], imports: [], exports: [NgClass,
            NgComponentOutlet,
            NgForOf,
            NgIf,
            NgTemplateOutlet,
            NgStyle,
            NgSwitch,
            NgSwitchCase,
            NgSwitchDefault,
            NgPlural,
            NgPluralCase,
            AsyncPipe,
            UpperCasePipe,
            LowerCasePipe,
            JsonPipe,
            SlicePipe,
            DecimalPipe,
            PercentPipe,
            TitleCasePipe,
            CurrencyPipe,
            DatePipe,
            I18nPluralPipe,
            I18nSelectPipe,
            KeyValuePipe] });
    CommonModule.ngInjectorDef = _angular_core__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__["defineInjector"]({ factory: function CommonModule_Factory(t) { return new (t || CommonModule)(); }, providers: [
            { provide: NgLocalization, useClass: NgLocaleLocalization },
        ], imports: [[COMMON_DIRECTIVES, COMMON_PIPES]] });
    return CommonModule;
}());
```


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
Use ivy in compatibility mode.

In `main.ts`
```js
import { enableProdMode } from '@angular/core';
import { platformBrowser } from '@angular/platform-browser';

import { AppModule } from './app/app.module';
import { environment } from './environments/environment';

if (environment.production) {
  enableProdMode();
}

platformBrowser().bootstrapModule(AppModule)
  .catch(err => console.error(err));
```
In `app.module.ts`, add `BrowserModule`
```js
import { BrowserModule } from '@angular/platform-browser';
import { NgModule } from '@angular/core';

import { AppComponent } from './app.component';

@NgModule({
  declarations: [
    AppComponent
  ],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule
  ],
  providers: [],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent]
})
export class AppModule { }
```
## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:** 7.2.0


**Anything else relevant?**
Been tried with https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/27848 and https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/13382

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): deps are actually supported
Issues.Body:
This code was throwing if the `deps` array of a provider has several elements, but at the next line it resolves them... With this check `ngtsc` couldn‚Äôt compile `ng-bootstrap` for example.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

The `deps` resolution is working but the guard stayed in place. The `ngcc` compilation of a module like `ng-bootstrap` fails with `7.2.0`.

Quoting @alxhub on Slack (back in November when I first spotted the issue): `Yeah, I think I wrote `getDep` later on when working on the same PR, and just forgot to remove the guard.`. 

## What is the new behavior?

The `ngcc` compilation of a module like `ng-bootstrap` succeeds.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: ngcc: missing ngInjectableDef in fesm5/common.js for Location
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/common ### Description `fesm5/common.js` has no `ngInjectableDef` for `Location` after running `ngcc`, whereas it exists for `fesm2015/common.js`, leading to an error at runtime when using Ivy. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ``` ng new ivy-location --defaults $(npm bin)/ivy-ngcc # enable ivy in `tsconfig.app.json` # add `RouterModule.forRoot([])` in app.module.ts ng serve --aot # check the runtime error in the browser ``` ## üî• Exception or Error In Firefox 

ERROR TypeError: "token is undefined"
	get http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:42903:13
	get http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:43265:20
	injectInjectorOnly http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:35691:16
	inject http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:35696:13
	Location_Factory ng://Location/ngInjectableDef.js:8:28
In Chrome: 

ERROR TypeError: Cannot read property '__source' of undefined
    at StaticInjector.push../node_modules/@angular/core/fesm5/core.js.StaticInjector.get (core.js:8984)
    at R3Injector.push../node_modules/@angular/core/fesm5/core.js.R3Injector.get (core.js:9346)
    at injectInjectorOnly (core.js:1772)
    at inject (core.js:1777)
    at Object.Location_Factory [as factory] (ngInjectableDef.js:8)
After digging a little bit, it looks like in `fesm5/common.js`, there is no `ngInjectableDef` metadata on `Location` (look for `Location_Factory` in `./node_modules/@angular/common/fesm5/common.js`). But it is present in `fesm2015/common.js`... ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: ngcc: Duplicate export 'HttpClientXsrfModule' in fesm5/http.js
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/common/http Last line of `./node_modules/@angular/common/fesm5/http.js` looks like: ``` export { ..., HttpClientJsonpModule, HttpClientModule, HttpClientXsrfModule, ... }; ``` After running `ngcc`, a new line appears just below: ``` export {HttpClientXsrfModule}; ``` Which then makes `ng build --aot` fail (if `HttpClientModule` is imported), with or without ivy enabled with: ``` ERROR in ./node_modules/@angular/common/fesm5/http.js 2024:9 Module parse failed: Duplicate export 'HttpClientXsrfModule' (2024:9) You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type. | */ | export { NoopInterceptor as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_a, JsonpCallbackContext as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_b, jsonpCallbackContext as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_c, BrowserXhr as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_d, HttpXsrfCookieExtractor as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_g, HttpXsrfInterceptor as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_h, XSRF_COOKIE_NAME as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_e, XSRF_HEADER_NAME as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_f, HttpBackend, HttpHandler, HttpClient, HttpHeaders, HTTP_INTERCEPTORS, JsonpClientBackend, JsonpInterceptor, HttpClientJsonpModule, HttpClientModule, HttpClientXsrfModule, HttpInterceptingHandler as …µHttpInterceptingHandler, HttpParams, HttpUrlEncodingCodec, HttpRequest, HttpErrorResponse, HttpEventType, HttpHeaderResponse, HttpResponse, HttpResponseBase, HttpXhrBackend, XhrFactory, HttpXsrfTokenExtractor }; > export { HttpClientXsrfModule }; ``` ### Is this a regression? The bug has been present since 7.0 releases (talked on Slack with @petebacondarwin ). ### Description `ngcc` exports `HttpClientXsrfModule` twice. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ``` ng new ivy-http --defaults cd ivy-http $(npm bin)/ivy-ngcc # check ./node_modules/@angular/common/fesm5/http.js # add HttpClientModule to AppModule ng build --aot ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 

ERROR in ./node_modules/@angular/common/fesm5/http.js 2024:9
Module parse failed: Duplicate export 'HttpClientXsrfModule' (2024:9)
You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type.
|  */
| export { NoopInterceptor as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_a, JsonpCallbackContext as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_b, jsonpCallbackContext as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_c, BrowserXhr as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_d, HttpXsrfCookieExtractor as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_g, HttpXsrfInterceptor as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_h, XSRF_COOKIE_NAME as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_e, XSRF_HEADER_NAME as …µangular_packages_common_http_http_f, HttpBackend, HttpHandler, HttpClient, HttpHeaders, HTTP_INTERCEPTORS, JsonpClientBackend, JsonpInterceptor, HttpClientJsonpModule, HttpClientModule, HttpClientXsrfModule, HttpInterceptingHandler as …µHttpInterceptingHandler, HttpParams, HttpUrlEncodingCodec, HttpRequest, HttpErrorResponse, HttpEventType, HttpHeaderResponse, HttpResponse, HttpResponseBase, HttpXhrBackend, XhrFactory, HttpXsrfTokenExtractor };

Issues.Title: `canActivate` in guard does not contain `UrlTree` (since Angular 7.1.0)
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
* macOS Mojave
* Node Version: v.10.14.0
* npm Version: 6.4.1
* Angular CLI Version: 7.2.1

### Repro steps
* Run: 
```
ng g guard my-example
CREATE src/app/my-example.guard.spec.ts (377 bytes)
CREATE src/app/my-example.guard.ts (419 bytes)
```
* open generated `my-example.guard.ts`, it contains:

```typescript
import { Injectable } from '@angular/core';
import { CanActivate, ActivatedRouteSnapshot, RouterStateSnapshot } from '@angular/router';
import { Observable } from 'rxjs';

@Injectable({
  providedIn: 'root'
})
export class MyExampleGuard implements CanActivate {
  canActivate(
    next: ActivatedRouteSnapshot,
    state: RouterStateSnapshot): Observable<boolean> | Promise<boolean> | boolean {
    return true;
  }
}
```

### The log given by the failure
There is no error given and nothing fails

### Desired functionality
As written in the Docs, the content should look like that and contain `UrlTree` in methods signature:
```typescript
import { Injectable } from '@angular/core';
import { CanActivate, ActivatedRouteSnapshot, RouterStateSnapshot } from '@angular/router';
import { Observable } from 'rxjs';

@Injectable({
  providedIn: 'root'
})
export class MyExampleGuard implements CanActivate {
  canActivate(
    next: ActivatedRouteSnapshot,
    state: RouterStateSnapshot): Observable<boolean|UrlTree>|Promise<boolean|UrlTree>|boolean|UrlTree {
    return true;
  }
}
```

### Mention any other details that might be useful
See: https://angular.io/api/router/CanActivate
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`canActivate` in guard does not contain `UrlTree` (since Angular 7.1.0)" (#13390)

Issues.Title: Dynamic component imports/declarations in prod builds
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ X] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ X] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
<!--
Output from: `node --version`, `npm --version` and `ng --version`.
  Windows (7/8/10). Linux (incl. distribution). macOS (El Capitan? Sierra? High Sierra?)
node: v10.14.2
npm: 6.4.1
@angular/cli: 7.1.4
-->


### Repro steps
Try to do your component imports for your module dynamically off a directory
```
import * as components from 'app/components';

const componentsArray = [];
Object.keys(components).forEach(name => componentsArray.push(components[name]));

@NgModule({
  declarations: [
    AppComponent,
    ...componentsArray
  ],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule,
  ],
  bootstrap: [
    AppComponent
  ]
})
export class AppModule { }
```

### The log given by the failure
<!-- Normally this include a stack trace and some more information. -->
ERROR in : Cannot determine the module for class SampleComponent in /.../projects/example/src/app/components/sample-component/sample.component.ts! Add SampleComponent to the NgModule to fix it.
Cannot determine the module for class OtherSampleComponent in /.../projects/example/src/app/components/other-sample/other-sample.component.ts! Add OtherSampleComponent to the NgModule to fix it.


### Desired functionality
When you have a project with a large count of components it can be a maintenance hazard to have a list of 100 imports. It's an easy step to forget when someone adds a new component, or renames them, or moves them to a different subdirectory. Using index.ts files you can get them all exported to a top-level directory, and then iterate over the import to get them all added to your module. This works fine for development but when I run a prod build it thinks I've never imported the components, even though they clearly are. As near as I can tell the only reason for this is that the names don't show up as an explicit import in the file itself.

I've done some console logging and confirmed that the output of this method is identical to if I just statically add them to the declarations array. There are no stray elements getting in, and every component is listed. 

I assume I'm missing some understanding of how the aot compilation handles index files and how that impacts this approach.


### Mention any other details that might be useful
This approach only seems to fail for components inside prod/aot builds. For non-prod/aot builds it works fine, for adding services to the module's providers it works, for importing ngrx effects it works.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dynamic component imports/declarations in prod builds" (#13416)

### Repro steps

### The log given by the failure
The server starts with following warning:
```
****************************************************************************************
This is a simple server for use in testing or debugging Angular applications locally.
It hasn't been reviewed for security issues.

DON'T USE IT FOR PRODUCTION!

```

### Desired functionality
This warning was not present in previous build, unless you've been running production builds (optimization: true)

### Mention any other details that might be useful
Relevant code in froom @dev-kit/(...)/dev-server/index.js

```
if (browserOptions.optimization) {
                this.context.logger.error(core_1.tags.stripIndents `
            ****************************************************************************************
            This is a simple server for use in testing or debugging Angular applications locally.
            It hasn't been reviewed for security issues.

            DON'T USE IT FOR PRODUCTION!
            ****************************************************************************************
`);
```

Since optimization is automatically translated to an object (from boolean) now, it will always be true. I believe the intent here was to only issue warning when someone is running ng-serve with production builds (?)

### Mention any other details that might be useful

Issues.Title: Object spread in environment files fails for production configuration when used in modules
Issues.Body:
<!--

### Versions

### Repro steps
<!--
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.
Please include: commands run (incl args), packages added, related code changes.
A link to a sample repo would help too.
-->

Step 1: Clone https://github.com/dougpool/aot-prod-env
Step 2: `ng serve -c dev` and check screen/console (works as desired)
Step 3: `ng serve -c production` and check screen/check console (missing common env message is the bug)


### The log given by the failure
<!-- Normally this include a stack trace and some more information. -->
N/A

### Desired functionality
<!--
What would like to see implemented?
What is the usecase?
-->
See project README.md for detailed expected output and examples

Environment files composed from other files should work in production mode and have properties copied into environment via the object spread operator and the environment is passed to another module

common-env.ts
```
export const commonEnv = {
  // Are we running in production mode
  production: false,

  // common mesg
  commonMessage: 'Seen by all envs',
};
```

environment.prod.ts
```
import * as common from './common-env';

export const environment = {
  ...common.commonEnv,
  production: true,
  envMessage: 'Prod message',
};
```
Code where correct environment fails to get created
app.module.ts snippet
```
@NgModule({
  declarations: [AppComponent],
 // env here is not correct
  imports: [BrowserModule, FeatureModuleModule.forRoot(env)],
  providers: [],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent],
})
```
Instead, the properties are not copied when the the application is served or built with the `ng` command.

### Mention any other details that might be useful
<!-- Please include a link to the repo if this is related to an OSS project. -->
Potentially related: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/9511

Issues.Title: Can not serve library
Issues.Body:
In latest versions of Angular cli, we can use `ng g library lib-name` command to create library. As mentioned in the Angular [docs][1] :
  
    ng serve <project>


And:

  [1]: https://angular.io/cli/serve

    <project>	The name of the project to build. Can be an app or a library.

So, we can serve **library**. But when I serve I get the following errors:

    Project 'ngx-tab-component' does not support the 'serve' target.
    Error: Project 'ngx-tab-component' does not support the 'serve' target.
    at ServeCommand.initialize (C:\Users\vahidnajafi\angular\ngx-tab-app\node_modules\@angular\cli\models\architect-command.js:53:19)
    at <anonymous>
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:188:7)
    at Function.Module.runMain (module.js:695:11)
    at startup (bootstrap_node.js:191:16)
    at bootstrap_node.js:612:3
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can not serve library" (#13411)

Issues.Title: refactor: use `.template` suffix for all schematic files
Issues.Body:
Currently when using `ivy-ngcc` it will print out a warning

```
Failed to read entry point info from //node_modules/@schematics/angular/workspace/files/package.json with error SyntaxError: Unexpected token < in JSON at position 1121.
```

Fixes #13378
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: use `.template` suffix for all schematic files" (#13410)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): Add progress reporters for webpack builds
Issues.Body:
- Add progress reporters for webpack builds. Previously only the default webpack progress handler was used. The default handler did not display well in all CI environments as it attempted to use the same console line for all progress updates.
- Add simple progress report, logging on new lines each time the build stage or build % changes.
- Add verbose progress report, logging on new lines on every progress update with additional data provided by webpack.
- Change default behaviour on non TTY consoles to use the simple progress report over the current behaviour of no progress reporting, this gives visibility over the status of build.

# Previews

## `default-webpack`
Delegate to default handler within ProgressPlugin in webpack (existing behaviour) 
![default-webpack](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4943487/50999097-53782e80-1521-11e9-9ec3-4e7588a3f973.gif)


## `simple-color`
Logging on new lines each time the build stage or build percentage changes (w/ colour)
![simple-color](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4943487/50999104-57a44c00-1521-11e9-911c-d01a6645b3e1.gif)

## `verbose-color`
Logging on new lines on every progress update with additional data provided by webpack (w colour)
![verbose-color](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4943487/50999111-5bd06980-1521-11e9-8ab7-7dd8e6169fbe.gif)

## `simple-plain`
Logging on new lines each time the build stage or build percentage changes (w/o colour)
![simple-plain](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4943487/50999116-5e32c380-1521-11e9-8c1f-dd3711729565.gif)

## `verbose-plain`
Logging on new lines on every progress update with additional data provided by webpack (w/o colour)
![verbose-plain](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4943487/50999123-60951d80-1521-11e9-9ae7-014471e77208.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): Add progress reporters for webpack builds" (#13405)

Issues.Title: Conditional ES5 Browser Polyfill Loading
Issues.Body:
- no need to manually import and manage individual ES2015 polyfills required by Angular
  - ES2015 polyfills are only loaded by browsers that require them
  - Controllable via a new `es5BrowserSupport` option; no behavior change if option is not enabled
  - `es5BrowserSupport` is enabled in newly generated projects
  - allows for custom polyfill solutions by not using the new option
  - works in conjunction with conditional JIT polyfills and will load ES2015 specific JIT polyfills as needed
  - Saves ~56KB on native ES2015 browsers
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Conditional ES5 Browser Polyfill Loading" (#13403)

Issues.Title: Angular.json scripts are not loading
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`) ``` - [X ] bug report - [ ] feature request ``` ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [X ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Versions **Angular Version:** 
Angular CLI: 7.1.4
Node: 10.7.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.1.4
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.11.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.11.4
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.11.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.11.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack      0.11.4
@angular-devkit/core               7.1.4
@angular-devkit/schematics         7.1.4
@angular/cdk                       7.2.0
@angular/flex-layout               7.0.0-beta.22
@angular/material                  7.2.0
@ngtools/json-schema               1.1.0
@ngtools/webpack                   7.1.4
@schematics/angular                7.1.4
@schematics/update                 0.11.4
ng-packagr                         4.4.5
rxjs                               6.3.3
typescript                         3.1.6
webpack                            4.23.1
### Description angular.json "scripts" are not loading for some reason **NOT WORKING** ``` "scripts": [ "node_modules/codemirror/mode/css/css.js", "node_modules/codemirror/mode/javascript/javascript.js", "node_modules/codemirror/mode/htmlmixed/htmlmixed.js" ] ``` but when I import scripts right into component where I use them, it **WORKS** ``` import '../../../../../../../../../node_modules/codemirror/mode/css/css.js'; import '../../../../../../../../../node_modules/codemirror/mode/javascript/javascript.js'; import '../../../../../../../../../node_modules/codemirror/mode/htmlmixed/htmlmixed.js'; ``` I don't like this 'workaround' to be fair, I tried to search why scripts are not loaded from angular.json, but haven't found any solutions except very bad 'workarounds' ### Desired functionality Scripts should be loaded from angular.json file
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular.json scripts are not loading" (#13402)

```

### Repro steps
1. ng new lint-issue 
2. cd lint-issue/ 
3. ng g library sample  
4. touch projects/sample/one.component.ts 
5. echo "" > projects/sample/one.component.ts 
6. ng lint  sample

Issues.Title: Proposal: Asset Budgets potentially w/ subtypes
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [x] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
Mac High Sierra

```
MacBook-Pro:~ damien$ node --version
v8.9.4
```
```
MacBook-Pro:~ damien$ npm --version
5.6.0
```

```
MacBook-Pro:daffodil damien$ ng --version

     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 7.1.0
Node: 8.9.4
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.1.1
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router, service-worker

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-webpack      0.10.7
@angular-devkit/core               7.1.0
@angular-devkit/schematics         7.1.0
@angular/cdk                       7.1.0
@angular/cli                       7.1.0
@angular/pwa                       0.11.3
@ngtools/json-schema               1.1.0
@ngtools/webpack                   7.0.7
@schematics/angular                7.1.0
@schematics/update                 0.11.0
ng-packagr                         4.4.0
rxjs                               6.3.3
typescript                         3.1.6
webpack                            4.19.1
```

### Repro steps
1. Have bundle with 2mb budget
2. Desire a budget that says all image assets are under 1mb.
3. Create an asset that is 1.5mb
4. Be unable to know that the asset outside of budget range as the "any" budget type will catch the bundle. 


### The log given by the failure
N/A

### Desired functionality
I would like to set a budget **specifically** for image assets in my `ng build`. Ideally, I can configure this per image type (as each image type has different compressability.

e.g
```
{
  ...
  "configurations": {
    "production": {
      ...
      budgets: [
         {"type": "asset:jpg", "maximumWarning": "150kb", "maximumError": "300kb"},
         {"type": "asset:svg", "maximumWarning": "15kb", "maximumError": "30kb"},
         {"type": "asset:png", "maximumWarning": "150kb", "maximumError": "300kb"},
       ]
    }
  }
}
```

The use case here is automation around enforcing filesize requirements for assets to prevent absurd image sizes from being included. While `"type": "any"` meets this requirement, there are niches of asset types that should have stricter requirements (e.g. `svg`).

### Mention any other details that might be useful
I'm trying to create budgets for the assets we use on the `Daffodil` project: 
https://github.com/graycoreio/daffodil

Specifically, the PR in question:
https://github.com/graycoreio/daffodil/pull/171
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Proposal: Asset Budgets potentially w/ subtypes" (#13393)

Issues.Title: build: fix incorrect amd module names
Issues.Body:
* Our UMD bundles currently have wrong AMD module names for secondary entry-points which are dash-cased. e.g. AMD module name for the bottom-sheet is `@angular/material/bottomSheet`.
* Our UMD bundles currently reference incorrect rollup globals. e.g. the AMD module name is `ng.material-experimental.{secondary}`, while it should be `ng.materialExperimental`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix incorrect amd module names" (#14786)

Issues.Title: fix(icon): clean up cached references in icon registry on destroy
Issues.Body: The icon registry can end up caching some fairly large SVG elements which may end up being retained, because we're using a regular `Map`. These changes clear out all the references if the registry is destroyed.

Issues.Title: Dynamic change in label of mat-option gives ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Error should not occur for this scenario.

#### What is the current behavior?
Error: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value: 'null:  '. Current value: 'null: Change to localized version'.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
**[StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qdpdx7)**

Essentially I mimicked a similar thing that I am seeing with this stackblitz.
In the real world we have pipe that goes to a service to retrieve a localized version of a string.
What happens is we call this pipe and it goes to a service that file does a http get for a json and finds a string that is in the proper language.

Our form field select is like so:
```
<mat-form-field>
  <mat-select
    id="clinicPrefReportsDropdown"
    class="select-reports"
    [disabled]="!isButtonEnabled"
    (selectionChange)="SelectReportsChanged($event)"
    [value]="SelectedReport"
  >
      <mat-option value="ClinicPreferredReports">{{
        'ClinicPreferredReports' | localize: localizationSection
      }}</mat-option>
       <mat-option value="MyPreferredReports">{{
        'MyPreferredReports' | localize: localizationSection
      }}</mat-option>
       <mat-option value="CustomReports">{{
          'CustomReports' | localize: localizationSection
      }}</mat-option>
  </mat-select>
</mat-form-field>
```

What happens is those labels start off as null and when the service comes back with the proper string it changes it and this is where the expressed changed error comes into play. So my stackblitz simulates this with having option1 as a variable in OnInit I put a setTimeout for 2 seconds to change the string and there error comes up.

I guess I am wondering if this is truly a bug or if I need to do something different to not allow this to happen. I did get this to work by manually calling a change detection after the localize variable we have gets populated (and take the pipe out of the equation) but this is a workaround to the problem I feel like.

Any thoughts?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dynamic change in label of mat-option gives ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError" (#14793)

Issues.Title: MatFormField documentation should prefer outline/fill style
Issues.Body: In the most recent Material Design update, the "standard" / "legacy" style is now omitted from the spec with only the outline and fill styles remaining. We should update our own documentation and examples to reflect this update.

Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.

Issues.Title: Plain text as matSuffix misaligned in appearance=outline
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Text as prefix/suffix is aligned with the input in a mat-form-field

#### What is the current behavior?
Text as prefix/suffix is not aligned with the input in a mat-form-field

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-matsuffix-text


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular, Material 7
Browsers: at least Chrome and FF, no others tested

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I think the misalignment comes from a workaround to align icons as prefix/suffix. It would be nice if both icons and text are aligned correctly!!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Plain text as matSuffix misaligned in appearance=outline" (#14784)

Issues.Title: [Datepicker] formControl value should have time changed, not only the date
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Binding mat-datepicker to FormControl changes the date but not the time resulting in the same time in every date object I save. example: "YYYY-MM-DDT00:00:00.000Z"
So if I have to compare values from the same date I can't do it.
Is there any option so the datePicker can give the exact time when I choose a date?

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.2.0, Material 7.2.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Datepicker] formControl value should have time changed, not only the date" (#14783)

Issues.Title: Opened expansion panels do not save their state in virtual scroll
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

When scrolling on a list of expansion panels  with the first one opened and then returning back to the top, the first panel should still be opened. 

#### What is the current behavior?

Scrolling will open others expansion panels that have the same position as the first one, also it misbehaves the UI.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

Just scrolling here after opening the first expansion panel: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-md-scrolling 

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angualr 7, MD 7,  TS 3

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Same thing if you choose to open the nth expansion panel on the list.
Used the ngx-infinite-scroll works well and keeps opened expansion panels state. So it is about MD Scrolling.

Authors: @hzitoun @alibenmessaoud
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Opened expansion panels do not save their state in virtual scroll" (#14781)

Issues.Title: (dialog) feature request: default result value for closing with esc or via backdrop click
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
**Current behaviour:** When a dialog is closed with esc or via backdrop click the provided result is `undefined`. 
**Desired behaviour:** Allow to set a default result for these situations. I'd see several possible ways of doing this, for example:
1. using the `MatDialogRef` and a to be created method (e.g. `setDefaultResult(...)`) to be able to set this value comfortably from within the dialog.
2. using the MatDialogConfig to be able to set the value from the code opening the dialog

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
We have some generic dialogs which also provide a "cancel" button that returns specific data. Currently everywhere the dialog is opened, we need to make a check whether the result is undefined or not. Providing a default value for those cases would definitely be better.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "(dialog) feature request: default result value for closing with esc or via backdrop click" (#14780)

Issues.Title: fix(tabs): better handling of animationDuration without units
Issues.Body: Based off of the discussions on #13428. Handles values passed to `animationDuration` that don't have units, rather than allowing them to continue through to  the `BrowserAnimationsModule` and to throw an error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(tabs): better handling of animationDuration without units" (#14778)
